data.title: WEST VIRGINIA OBITUARIES
data.text:
WEST VIRGINIA OBITUARIES OF ALFORDS

AND SPELLING VARIATIONS

Obituaries are listed alphabetically by FIRST name. Included are people whose last name, maiden name, or married name is Alford or a spelling variation: Alfred, Alvord, Allford, Halford, Hallford, Holford, etc.

The name of the newspaper (or other source) and place and date of publication follow the name of the deceased. If we included the obituary in AAFA ACTION, the issue is noted.

The Alford American Family Association (AAFA) often adds notes to each obituary, including Social Security Death Index (SSDI) data, relationship of the deceased to other Alfords, and lineages. We add to AAFA NOTES as time permits.

Where lineages are included (Alford unless otherwise stated), the format is: Name, year of birth, state or country of birth.

Obituaries of AAFA members and sometimes their spouses are also included on AAFA Member Memorials and may include more information.

We welcome corrections and additional information. If you have an obituary from this state that is not included here, please share it with us!

Date posted: 16 SEPTEMBER 2023

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The families of many of the subjects of these West Virginia obituaries are represented in AAFA Alford Genealogies published on this website, where we are referring readers for more information.

*AAFAs Online Published Genealogies:

1. Descendants of John & Mary Alford of Frederick County VA (DNA Group 2)

2. Known Descendants of Charles J. Alfred and Agnes Langford

3. Descendants of Irish John Alford (DNA Group 97)

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Frequently cited sources include these databases at Ancestry and Family Search Historical Record Collections, West Virginia, usually linked to images of the certificates at West Virginia Division of Culture and History, Vital Research Records Search Selection:

WV Births: West Virginia Births, 18531930; also, West Virginia Births Index, 18041938 (Ancestry)

WV Marriages: West Virginia Marriages, 17801970; also West Virginia, Marriages Index, 17851971 (Ancestry)

WV Deaths: West Virginia Deaths, 18041999; also West Virginia, Deaths Index, 18531973 (Ancestry)

SSDI: Social Security Death Index, 19352014

SSACI: Social Security Applications and Claims Index, 1936-2007

******************************************

ABIGAIL CRANOGWEN THOMAS ALFORD

DAILY MAIL

Charleston, Kanawha Co., WVMonday, 16 December 1968

Mrs. Abigail Alford, 83, of 930 Park St., St. Albans, died Sunday [December 15] in Thomas Memorial Hospital. She was a member of the St. Albans First Presbyterian Church.

Her son, Clyde Alford, is the assistant football coach at St. Albans Junior High School and a councilman in St. Albans.

Service will be conducted Tuesday at 2 p.m. in the Bartlett Funeral Home in St. Albans by the Rev. Leonard Underwood. Burial will be in Teays Hill Cemetery .

Photo from Teays Hill Cemetery, St. Albans, Kanawha Co., WVwww.findagrave.com

Permission granted by the photographer, Family Heritage of the Virginias [Norris Lynn Alford, AAFA #0422]

AAFA NOTES: See the obituaries of her husband, Frank Leslie Alford; and son Clyde Daniel Alford Sr. in this compilation.

From WV Deaths: The death certificate for Abigail Corrighan Alford says she was born 25 July 1885 in Minersville, Meigs Co., OH, the daughter of Daniel Thomas and Emma Morgan, both born in Wales. (Emma lists her birth place as WV on the 1900 and 1910 censuses.)

From WV Marriages: Frank Leslie Alford, age 25, married Abigail Cranogwen Thomas, age 21, in Winfield, Putnam Co., WV, on 2 June 1907.

Ohio County Births, 18412003 (FamilySearch.org) lists Abigail Thomas, born 25 July 1885 in Minersvile, Meigs Co., OH, daughter of Daniel C. Thomas and Emma Morgans. This source also lists the births of 3 brothers of Abigail (William, Richard, and Ed) in Meigs Co. from 1877 to 1883, parents listed as Daniel L. Thomas and Emma J. Morgan.

From WV Deaths: Daniel Llewlyn Thomas and Emma Morgan are listed as the parents of Richard Glyndwr Thomas, born 1883 OH and died 1962 WV.

ADA CATHERINE ALFORD ENNIS MCCOY

CHARLESTON GAZETTE

Charleston, Kanawha Co., WVTuesday, 3 November 1998

HUNTINGTONA. Catherine Ennis McCoy, 49, of Huntington died Nov. 1, 1998, in St. Josephs Hospital, Buckhannon, after a short illness.

She was a supervisor at Olivers Restaurant, Huntington, a part-time employee of the Wrens Nest, St. Albans, and a Baptist.

Surviving: husband, Joseph McCoy; son, Darrell Gene Ennis of Garretts Bend; brother, Wilbern Alford of Wilmington, N.C.; sister, Ellen Harrison of Burgaw, N.C.; two grandchildren.

Service will be 11 a.m. Wednesday at Casdorph & Curry Funeral Home, St. Albans . Burial will be in Grandview Memorial Park, Dunbar .

Photo from Grandview Memorial Park, Dunbar, Kanawha Co., WVwww.findagrave.com

Permission granted by the photographer, Kenny Davis

AAFA NOTES: SSDI records do not list her death.

See the obituaries of her father Andy William Alford; her brother Jasper William Alford; and her half-brother Wilbern Lee Shorty Alford Sr. in this compilation.

Catherine was born 23 Nov 1948, the daughter of Andy William Alford and Oma Jane Wheeler. Her first husband was Larry Franklin Ennis.

*See AAFAs Published Genealogies, #3.

Her lineage: Ada Catherine 1948 WV1, Andy William 1912 WV2, Lorenzo Dow 1883 WV3, James Bird 1855 VA4, Robert 1814 VA5, George 1763 Ireland6, John 1735 Ireland7.

ALICE LORRAINE ADKINS ALFORD

Alice Lorraine Alford

August 4, 1924March 24, 2021

Photo and dates from Gatens-Harding Funeral Home

CHARLESTON GAZETTE-MAIL

Charleston, Kanawha Co., WVSunday, 28 March 2021

Alice Lorraine Adkins Alford, 96 of Poca went home to be with the Lord on March 24, 2021 at her residence with her family by her side.

Mrs. Alford is preceded in death by her late husband of 57 years, Mr. Roy Washington Alford, Jr.

Alice was born in Boone County to the late C. Frazier and Myrtle Adkins. She began her teaching career in Boone County and Michigan and then came to Poca High School in 1947 and taught for 38 years, retiring in 1985. She founded PHS Future Business Leaders of America Club, served as member and officer in Southern Business Education Association, member of Phi Delta Kappa Education honorary society and was a member of Putnam County Association of Retired School Employees. Alice was a member of Poca United Methodist Church and was always found supporting her late husband in all his positions with the Lions Club.

Alice is survived by her daughters Clora Craigo and Charlene and her husband Glen Lovejoy and grandson Anthony Lovejoy.

A tribute to the life of Mrs. Alice Alford will be 3 p.m., Tuesday March 30, 2021 at Gatens-Harding Funeral Home Chapel . Burial will follow in Haven of Rest Memorial Gardens .

AAFA NOTES: SSDI records do not yet list her death.

See the obituary of her husband, Roy Washington Alford Jr., in this compilation.

Services will be held at Curry Funeral Home, Alum Creek, on Saturday, April 16, 1994 at 11:00 AM . Burial will be held at Graceland Memorial Park, So. Charleston .

She is also preceded in death by the father of her children Cecil Slim Jeffers; one granddaughter, Mandy Stickler; one great granddaughter, Keylei Ann Meadows ; one brother and two sisters.

She is survived by her husband Thomas Eugene Doneff; one son, Wade Jeffers; four daughters, Reta Nudo, Sheila Finley, Donna Cupp (Johnny) and Tina Jeffers; one brother, Roger Alford; 8 grandchildren and 8 great grandchildren and a host of other family and friends.

HAMLINMrs. Annie Alford Cash, 81, of Garretts Bend [Lincoln Co.], died yesterday at her home after a short illness. She was a member of the Church of Christ at Garretts Bend.

Mrs. Lon Spurlock, Mrs. Frank McCallister and Mrs. Cora Meadows of Hurricane; 14 grandchildren and 15 great-grandchildren.

Services will be held tomorrow at 2 p.m. in Dry Branch Elementary School by Minister Gerald Watts. Burial will be in McDowell Cemetery at Garretts Bend. The body is at Koontz Funeral Home here.

BARBARA ANN MCVEY ALFRED

Hardman-Paletti Funeral Home

Weston, Lewis Co., WV_____ September 2009

Barbara Ann Alfred, 75, of Old Mill Road Weston passed away at 12:40 a.m. on Thursday, September 3, 2009 at her residence following a short illness.

She was born in Muskeegum County, Ohio on December 23, 1933: daughter of the late John Ross McVey and Carrie Nevada (Hodge) McVey. On October 7, 1954, she married Dick Alfred, who survives.

Also surviving is one daughter: Debbie Murray and husband Bill of Weston, four grandchildren: Danny Murray (Chasidy), Sam Murray (Jennifer), Jon Murray and Ashley Murray, four great grandchildren: Megan Brooke Murray, Ian Thomas Murray, Nicholas Michael Murray and McKensie Jo Murray and several nieces and nephews. In addition to her parents, Mrs. Alfred was preceded in death by two brothers: infant brother Roger McVey and Norman McVey and five sisters: infant sister Mary McVey, Gracie Drumm, Eloise Dublin, Vera Murphy, and Madeline McMaster.

Mrs. Alfred was co-owner of Alfred Exterminating from 1971-1997. She also retired from Weston State Hospital as a psychiatric aide and later a switchboard operator. Barbara was a member of St. Patrick Catholic Church of Weston and a graduate of Weston High School with the Class of 1952.

Family and friends will be received at the Hardman-Paletti Funeral Home 730 N. Main Avenue Weston on Friday, September 4, 2009 from 6-8 p.m. A Mass of Christian burial will be held at 2:00 p.m. from St. Patrick Catholic Church of Weston with Father Steve Vellalonga as celebrant. Interment will follow services in Forest Lawn Memorial Gardens of Jane Lew, WV. A Rosary will be recited on Friday at 7:00 p.m. from the funeral home chapel .

Hardman-Paletti Funeral Home of Weston is in charge of arrangements for Barbara Ann Alfred.

AAFA NOTES: SSDI records confirm the birth and death dates of Barbara A. Alfred (SS# issued in SC), last residence Weston, Lewis Co., WV.

See the obituary of her husband, Clarence Dixon Dick Alfred, in this compilation. It includes a photo of their shared gravestone.

BESSIE JOSEPHINE ALFORD MASSEY

[Although she died in Ohio, we are also including her obituary here because of her close ties to West Virginia.]

CHARLESTON GAZETTE

Elsie Jewell White, 93, of Milton peacefully passed away on Nov. 5, 2005, following a long illness. Visitation will be from 6 to 8 p.m. Sunday, Nov. 6, at Heck Funeral Home, Milton. Funeral service will be conducted at 11 a.m. Monday, Nov. 7, 2005, at Heck Funeral Home . Burial will follow in the Bicker Cemetery on Barkers Ridge Road, Milton.

Jewell was born Jan. 15, 1912, in Hurricane, W.Va., a daughter of the late Joseph Willard Pete and Flora Ann Woodall Alford. She was retired from BASF and as a personal caregiver. She was a long time member of Mt. Moriah Missionary Baptist Church of Hurricane, being baptized at the age of 16.

In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Oval Lee White; three brothers, Homer, Willard and Bernie Alford; five sisters, Verba White, Velma Scarberry, Margie Barnett, Virgie Fizer and Gracie Alford.

She is survived by one daughter and son-in-law, Phyllis Jean and Floyd Jack Hickman of Milton; one grandson, Randy Lee Hickman; one granddaughter, Benita Lynn Ryalls, both of Milton; three great-grandchildren, Cassie Lynn Ryalls of Asheville, N.C., Zachary Brad Ryalls of Milton and Jasmin Lee Chaney Hickman of Culloden; and several special nieces and nephews. Thanks to Sunbridge Care and Rehabilitation, especially to the employees of the North Front Hall and to Hospice Care of Kanawha County. Online condolences may be sent at www.heckfuneralhome.net.

Thanks to Sunbridge Care and Rehabilitation, especially to the employees of the North Front Hall and to Hospice Care of Kanawha County.

ELVIN SAMUEL ALFORD, JR.

Curry Funeral Home

Alum Creek, Kanawha Co., WV_____ October 2014

Samuel Alford, Jr., 87, of South Charleston, left to be with Jesus Saturday, October 25, 2014 at Hubbard Hospice, Charleston.

He was a retired Waymaster from Union Carbide, South Charleston; he attended the Alum Creek Church of the Nazarene and served in the Army Air Corps in Korea during World War II.

Junior was preceded in death by his grandson, Marc Sparks; parents, Elvin Sr. and Thelma Alford; brothers and sisters-in-law, Curtis and his first wife, Katie Alford and Ray and Betty Alford; and sister and brother-in-law, Jessie and Charles Blalock.

He is survived by his loving wife of 64 years, Margaret Peggy Stafford Alford; daughters, Karen Sparks of South Charleston and Margie (Robert) Childress of North Carolina; sons, David Alford of South Charleston and Terry (Tereasa) Alford of Garretts Bend; 10 grandchildren, 23 great grandchildren, 7 great great grandchildren and several nieces, nephews and cousins.

Funeral service will be 1:00 pm Friday, October 31, at Curry Funeral Home, 2097 Childress Road, Alum Creek . Entombment will follow at Tyler Mountain Memory Gardens, Cross Lanes with military graveside rites conducted by the Alum Creek VFW 4768 .

Erma Mae Wade, 93, of Griffithsville [Lincoln Co.], went home to be with the Lord Saturday, January 11, 2014 at Hospice West, South Charleston, after a long illness.
